current_company.title: Business Architecture Senior Analyst @ Accenture Japan | IIT Kharagpur

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: Title: Prediction of EPS for different firms* Worked on developing a time series model for predicting a firm’s future Earning per Share(EPS) for over 5000 US-based companies by working on macroeconomic data spanning over 35 years.* Implemented Random Forest Regressor, RNN and ARIMA on this data and the model performed better than 33.8% of Equity Analysts.* Implemented these models on a Transition window basis which increased the percentage of Equity analysts beaten to 34.9%.* Worked on algorithmic trading models for the Indian equity market by replicating research papers like Mohanram’s G-Score and Complicated Firms.
experience.description_html: Title: Prediction of EPS for different firms* Worked on developing a time series model for predicting a firm’s future Earning per Share(EPS) for over 5000 US-based companies by working on macroeconomic data spanning over 35 years.* Implemented Random Forest Regressor, RNN and ARIMA on this data and the model performed better than 33.8% of Equity Analysts.* Implemented these models on a Transition window basis which increased the percentage of Equity analysts beaten to 34.9%.* Worked on algorithmic trading models for the Indian equity market by replicating research papers like Mohanram’s G-Score and Complicated Firms.

experience.title: Intern
experience.description: Title: Open-Domain Question Answering* Worked on developing a Question-Answering model using Wikipedia as the unique knowledge source.* Used Neural Ranking model to retrieve Top 100 documents based on the query and document similarity scores from Wikipedia dump.* Trained BERT on SQuAD (Question-Answering dataset) as the Reader Model which improved the accuracy by 4% over the DrQA model.* Generated more Negative Samples(Questions with no answers) by using the SQuAD 2.0 dataset and then trained the Reader Model and improved the accuracy of the model by 2.9%.
experience.description_html: Title: Open-Domain Question Answering* Worked on developing a Question-Answering model using Wikipedia as the unique knowledge source.* Used Neural Ranking model to retrieve Top 100 documents based on the query and document similarity scores from Wikipedia dump.* Trained BERT on SQuAD (Question-Answering dataset) as the Reader Model which improved the accuracy by 4% over the DrQA model.* Generated more Negative Samples(Questions with no answers) by using the SQuAD 2.0 dataset and then trained the Reader Model and improved the accuracy of the model by 2.9%.

experience.title: Project Intern
experience.description: Title: Using social media for classifying actionable insights in a disaster scenario.* Classifying microblogging in twitter into categories of Need Tweets and Availability Tweets during the Nepal Earthquake disaster.* Built a TF-IDF based model using NLTK and Lucene for classification and achieved an accuracy of 86%.* Built a model using LSTM and achieved an accuracy of 92%.
experience.description_html: Title: Using social media for classifying actionable insights in a disaster scenario.* Classifying microblogging in twitter into categories of Need Tweets and Availability Tweets during the Nepal Earthquake disaster.* Built a TF-IDF based model using NLTK and Lucene for classification and achieved an accuracy of 86%.* Built a model using LSTM and achieved an accuracy of 92%. <!---->

experience.title: Sports Secretary
experience.description: Under my secretaryship B.R. Ambedkar Hall participated in various Sports event in General Championship and secured a Gold Medal in Inter Hall Football for the first time since it’s inauguration and achieved praiseworthy results in Cricket and Badminton.

projects: [{"title":"Natural Language Processing and Complex Networks","start_date":"Jun 2018","end_date":"Present","description":"* Professor- Pawan Goyal* Determining hypernym-hyponym relations among word pairs embedded in a network.* Finding Manual feature vectors in a word pair to determine the more general word like:- Average Degree of Context- Number of neighbors of context- Context of specific word should be a subset of the general word- Degree Entropy Of the Network* Using different Classifiers to get the best results"},{},{},{"title":"Natural Language Processing and Information Retrieval","start_date":"May 2018","end_date":"Sep 2018","description":"Prof- Pabitra Mitra* Using social media for classifying actionable insights in disaster scenario.* Classifying micro blogging in twitter into categories of needs and availability tweets using NLTK and Lucene.* Use of SVM, MNB and Naive Bayes algorithm to further improve the classification task."},{}]
